text: the indie rock singer-songwriter Shawn
Marshall who records as cat power was in
New York City last week on her fall tour
promoting her new CD the greatest MS
Marshalls lush vocals have garnered her
wide acclaim but her erratic onstage
behavior has left some fans frustrated
she sat down with us at the Mercer hotel
to give an intimate interview detailing
her spiral into alcoholism and her
recovery as people do tend to have
transformations in themselves in their
lives you know like me being sober now
and never having been like that ever
even playing my first all my shows I was
always intoxicated and always kind of
not there which led to a lot of the
depression and a lot of the like
uncomfortableness and with myself more
than the audience more than the you know
the problems with the piano or the scent
was more about uncomfortableness with
just being in my own skin and that's why
the alcohol is always with me but I
realized that that's why I was
uncomfortable because I was depressed
because I always had this chemical in me
was always unbalanced forever sorry I'm
talking so open about it but I really
needed help but it realized that a
problem and I was so depressed drinking
so much
and I never thought I could stop and
stuff I just like lose your mind I lost
my mind
drink and drink and drink and drink and
drink and drink and drink and drink and
drink and drink and I just lost my mind
luckily they thought they said I was
supposed to be there for a few weeks and
luckily they let me out on the seventh
day the breaking point after four days I
refused to eat and take the Medicaid you
know they wanted to like call me down
and stuff because I was hadn't slept and
like I aren't going on ten days it was
on the third day I finally gave in like
you know just like ask god it's just I
can't I'm tired I can't do this
the people were around me and I just
like stood on my tippy-toes and I was
just like I was asking him to take me
just take me
I just identify with her a lot like as a
woman and when I got sober I was
actually in the hospital to get sober
and she was on TV with Oprah and it was
like talking about you don't drink no
more you know and she doesn't do drugs
no more and like just her strength and
her courage to keep living and keep
trying to be strong and trying to be you
know a good woman right by God and this
you know just powerful woman I just
can't say enough about how much I love
her I just feel like it just love her so
much
I stopped it I stopped the tour I
couldn't go on tour my brain started
thinking how am I going to talk to every
fan I'm sorry how am I going to talk to
every promoter I'm sorry my record had
come out when I was in the hospital
Kanye was on the controversial cover in
The Rolling Stone you know great great
cover you know as Christ you know pretty
intense and I couldn't believe it I was
in there and I had a picture of painting
of me I was like that's me you know what
I mean I've never really noticed that
they liked me before I was so unwanted
with self-hatred and self-denial and
just uh that I never realized people
were coming to see me play I never knew
that before until Town Hall and up was
my first New York show I saw everybody
there I couldn't you know just like
tears like thank you you know I realized
like man these people stuck with me like
half of them probably know behalf of her
probably don't but like the ones that do
like stuck with me you want to mean
peace
as far as we were ends up have we come
